name: Archery 2020
description:
1st Place : 2020 Technology Student Association Video Game Design State Competition - Georgia

Theme: 2020 Olympics

Archery 2020.zip includes three folders:
  • non-VR version
  • VR version for use with the Oculus Rift or Rift S 
  • VR version for Oculus Quest 1 or 2 (.apk)

Archery 2020: The Path To Tokyo is a competitive archery game that would have taken place at the 2020 Olympics, if Covid 19 had not canceled the event. 

The game has two basic modes: Campaign and Practice. The Practice game mode allows the player to select a location, then remain there for as many rounds of archery as desired. Alternatively, the Campaign game mode takes the player across several countries, beginning in the United States, then to Russia, Japan, and finally ending up at the archery event in the 2020 Tokyo Games. This is the “the Path to Tokyo.” The idea being an emphasis on the various countries that participate in the event, while at the same time giving the player the educational experience of shooting a bow competitive archery.

There are currently four locations for our virtual archers to travel on “the Path to Tokyo.” The United States is a farm scene, where young professional archers might begin their careers. Russia offers a glimpse into a post-Soviet city, where an archer might rise to maturity. Finally arriving in Japan, the archer is now training in the finer arts of balance and harmony with the bow in a night-time Japanese zen garden. Now with the skills required, the archer at last is prepared for the world class archery competition at the Tokyo Games, where the crowd reacts to every miss, and every bull’s eye.
